alert.note: Alert for Washington (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued March 03 at 4:26PM EST until March 04 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TO 9 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways (5.2 to 5.4 feet Mean Lower Low Water). * WHERE...Washington RI County. * WHEN...From 5 AM to 9 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A storm surge around 2.5 feet is expected with some risk for up to a 3 ft surge. && Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Westerly RI at Watch Hill MLLW Categories - Minor 5.0 ft, Moderate 8.0 ft, Major 9.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.9 ft, Moderate 4.9 ft, Major 6.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 03/06 PM 3.1/ 3.6 0.0/ 0.5 1.0/ 1.5 1-2 None 04/07 AM 5.1/ 5.6 2.0/ 2.5 2.7/ 3.2 6-7 Minor 04/07 PM 3.1/ 3.6 0.0/ 0.5 0.9/ 1.4 5 None 05/07 AM 3.7/ 4.2 0.6/ 1.1 1.3/ 1.8 2-3 None 05/07 PM 2.5/ 3.0 -0.7/-0.2 0.2/ 0.7 2 None 06/08 AM 2.3/ 2.8 -0.8/-0.2 -0.2/ 0.3 2 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
